arts.ttl: Mateta's late penalty rescues Palace from defeat against Leicester
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta’s brace, including a stoppage-time penalty, denied Leicester City their first win since returning to the Premier League as Crystal Palace came from behind to draw 2-2. Mateta dragged Palace back into the match with his first goal moments later, but Leicester looked set to hang on despite being put under heavy pressure in the second half.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace boss delivers verdict on Eddie Nketiah debut and provides Cheick Doucoure injury update after Leicester draw
arts.sum: “It was a good debut for Eddie.” Two goals in the second half from Jean-Philippe Mateta saw the Eagles claim their second point of the season.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner highlights where Crystal Palace need to improve after Leicester draw
arts.sum: Crystal Palace boss Oliver Glasner was pleased with his side’s reaction for coming back from two goals down to pick up a point in their 2-2 draw with Leicester on Saturday afternoon. The Eagles have picked up two points from their opening four Premier League fixtures.

arts.ttl: Oliver Glasner says Palace working hard to progress up to ‘excellent’ football
arts.sum: Jean-Philippe Mateta’s brace earned Palace a point.

arts.ttl: Late Mateta penalty saves Palace against Leicester
arts.sum: Crystal Palace's Jean-Philippe Mateta scored twice including a last-gasp penalty as they clawed their way back from two goals down to salvage a 2-2 Premier League draw against promoted Leicester City at Selhurst Park on Saturday.

arts.ttl: Glasner on positives and negatives from Leicester draw
arts.sum: Oliver Glasner says he is not happy with the result, but was pleased by the character shown by his side in Crystal Palace’s 2-2 draw with Leicester City.

arts.ttl: Crystal Palace 2-2 Leicester: Highlights, man of the match, stats
Leicester ratings v Crystal Palace as Ndidi responds to doubters in gutting draw
arts.sum: Within 20 seconds of the restart, City were two goals up, Ndidi showing superb composure to tee up Mavididi for a volley after a cross wasn’t cleared. City started energetically, pressing from the front, and Ndidi charged down Marc Guehi’s clearance before crossing, Ayew failing to connect properly with the volley, bouncing the ball down into the ground and over.

arts.ttl: Jean-Philippe Mateta’s stoppage-time penalty salvages a draw for Crystal Palace
arts.sum: The Eagles came back from two goals down for a point.

arts.ttl: Report: Resilient Palace fight back to beat 10-man Norwich
arts.sum: Crystal Palace Under-18s recorded their third straight win in a row across all competitions after coming back from a goal down to defeat Norwich City 4-2 at Copers Cope. Goals from Benjamin Casey, Jesse Derry, Jasper Judd and Kai-Reece Adams-Collman secured the points for the young Eagles.
